heading: Mega Cheat Sheet Markdown
markdown_content:
# üåê Markdown Mega Demo Page

Welcome to the *ultimate Markdown test file*.  
This page demonstrates all the major Markdown features in a single narrative.

---

## 1. Introduction

Markdown is a lightweight markup language for creating formatted text.  
It‚Äôs widely used in *documentation, *notes, and README.md files.

> ‚ÄúMarkdown allows you to focus on writing, not formatting.‚Äù ‚Äî Anonymous Developer

---

## 2. Headings

# Heading Level 1  
## Heading Level 2  
### Heading Level 3  
#### Heading Level 4  
##### Heading Level 5  
###### Heading Level 6  

---

## 3. Paragraphs and Emphasis

This is a normal paragraph.  
It can include *bold, *italic, **bold italic**, ~strikethrough~, ==highlighted text==, and <u>underlined text</u>.

Here‚Äôs some inline code: print("Hello World").

---

## 4. Lists

### Unordered List
- Apple  
- Banana  
  - Sub-banana  
- Cherry  

### Ordered List
1. Step one  
2. Step two  
   1. Substep  
3. Step three  

### Task List
- [x] Write content  
- [x] Add examples  
- [ ] Review draft  
- [ ] Publish  

### Definition List
Markdown  
: A lightweight markup language.  
HTML  
: HyperText Markup Language.  

---

## 5. Blockquotes

> Markdown blockquotes are easy.  
> They can span multiple lines.  
>> You can even nest them.  
>>> Deep nesting works too!  

---

## 6. Code Blocks

### Inline
Use git status to check repo status.

### Fenced Code Block
python
def greet(name):
    print(f"Hello, {name}")

greet("Markdown")


### Indented Code Block
    SELECT * FROM users
    WHERE active = 1;

---

## 7. Links

- [Inline link](https://example.com)  
- [Inline link with title](https://example.com "Example Title")  
- [Reference link][ref1]  
- Autolink: <https://example.com>  

[ref1]: https://example.com "Reference Example"

---

## 8. Images

![Placeholder Image](https://via.placeholder.com/150 "Sample Image")  

---

## 9. Tables

| Name    | Age | Role      |  
|---------|-----|-----------|  
| Alice   | 24  | Developer |  
| Bob     | 30  | Designer  |  
| Charlie | 35  | Manager   |  

---

## 10. Horizontal Rules

---

---

## 11. Footnotes

This is a fact with a footnote.[^1]  
And here‚Äôs another one.[^2]  

[^1]: First footnote explanation.  
[^2]: Second footnote detail.  

---

## 12. Emoji

Here are some emoji: üòÉ üöÄ ‚úÖ üí° üî•  

---

## 13. Math

Inline math: $E = mc^2$  

Block math:  

$$
\int_0^\infty e^{-x} \, dx = 1
$$  

---

## 14. Advanced (if supported)

<details>
<summary>Click to expand details</summary>

Inside this collapsible section you can put text, code, lists, or anything else.

- Example item
- Another item

</details>

---

## 15. Conclusion

You‚Äôve now seen almost every Markdown feature.  
Go ahead and *copy, paste, and test* this file in your Markdown renderer.

---

*End of Demo*
